page.title: 18WILD FLOWERS OF NANTGLYN.
page.content: The narrow hedge lined lanes show a varied ecology. A grass bank on a farm lane provided an ideal site to study the local flora. The lane was not affected by car fumes, and the verge was not cut or treated. The bank was south facing at a height of 220m. with a light loamy soil. The tallest and most abundant plants were cow parsley and foxgloves. Close to the ground were typical June flowering plants such as speedwell with its pale blue flowers, red campion, herb robert, timothy and stitchwort. A rare wild flower present was { {climbing corydalis}with its clusters of pale creamy yellow flowers. This plant was previously seen in an oak coppice to the north but its presence in this verge was new.
